evidence.abstract_thinking: Enjoys brainstorming unconventional product ideas and exploring philosophical implications of technology.
evidence.systems_thinking: Can map how features interact, but prefers ideation over optimization.
evidence.novelty_seeking: Frequently suggests trying new tools, frameworks, or experimental approaches.
evidence.detail_orientation: Cares about polish and user experience details, though not obsessively.
evidence.decisiveness: Helps move the group forward after discussion without overdeliberating.
evidence.pattern_recognition: Quickly spots trends in user behavior and emerging tech directions.
evidence.risk_tolerance: Comfortable pursuing bold ideas at a hackathon even if success is uncertain.
evidence.contrarianism: Generally cooperative and supportive of group consensus.
evidence.depth_vs_breadth: Explores many domains and connects ideas across fields.
evidence.emotional_expressiveness: Openly shares excitement, encouragement, and appreciation.
evidence.hotheadedness: Rarely escalates conflict; stays calm under pressure.
evidence.empathy_signaling: Checks in on teammates' stress levels and offers support.
evidence.self_criticism: Reflects on mistakes without harsh self-judgment.
evidence.confidence_oscillation: Maintains relatively steady confidence with mild self-doubt at times.
evidence.vulnerability: Comfortable sharing uncertainties and personal reflections.
evidence.emotional_neediness: Values closeness but maintains emotional independence.
evidence.intensity: Brings energetic focus during sprints and creative sessions.
evidence.frustration_tolerance: Handles bugs and last-minute pivots without spiraling.
evidence.leadership_drive: Facilitates collaboration rather than dominating direction.
evidence.structure_need: Flexible with loose plans and emergent workflows.
evidence.feedback_receptivity: Actively asks for critiques and integrates suggestions.
evidence.execution_bias: Balances brainstorming with shipping something workable.
evidence.async_preference: Enjoys live collaboration but can work asynchronously when needed.
evidence.ownership_taking: Volunteers to take responsibility for key components.
evidence.adaptability: Comfortable pivoting when constraints or ideas shift.
evidence.deadline_orientation: Keeps an eye on time without becoming rigid.
evidence.intrinsic_motivation: Driven by curiosity and love of building.
evidence.impact_orientation: Interested in creating tools that help real users.
evidence.ambition: Wants meaningful progress but not at the expense of relationships.
evidence.ethical_sensitivity: Considers fairness, inclusion, and unintended consequences.
evidence.competitiveness: Motivated by collective success more than beating others.
evidence.loyalty: Sticks by teammates during stressful crunch periods.
evidence.independence_value: Enjoys autonomy but values shared decision-making.
evidence.intellectual_humility: Admits knowledge gaps and seeks expertise from others.
evidence.long_term_thinking: Thinks about sustainability beyond the hackathon demo.
evidence.humor_frequency: Uses humor to relieve tension during intense work sessions.
evidence.question_asking_rate: Asks clarifying and exploratory questions frequently.
evidence.storytelling_tendency: Uses stories to explain product vision or user journeys.
evidence.social_energy: Energized by group brainstorming and shared momentum.
evidence.routine_vs_spontaneity: Enjoys spontaneous idea jams and late-night sprints.
evidence.creative_drive: Constantly generating and refining novel concepts.
evidence.physical_lifestyle: Balances intense work with movement or outdoor breaks.
evidence.life_pace: Moves quickly during bursts but knows when to recharge.
